messages.messageBody:

>
> Hi Deanna,
>
> Check this article out and see if it helps you see what our guys are
experiencing. It sure helped me embrace my sons need to explore the
gory stuff. I pulled this off of Sandradodd.com under the video games
heading. She has a ton of stuff to browse regarding video games, kids
nad learning, so i suggest checking her site out as well.
>
>
http://www.motherjones.com/commentary/columns/2000/06/violent_media.html


***********************************


Thank you. And why is it that I consider it such a boy thing when it's
not?

Deanna

messages.subject: Re: Video games rating
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Deanna, Check this article out and see if it helps you see what our guys are experiencing. It sure helped me embrace my sons need to explore the gory stuff.
messages.messageBody:
Hi Deanna,

Check this article out and see if it helps you see what our guys are experiencing. It sure helped me embrace my sons need to explore the gory stuff. I pulled this off of Sandradodd.com under the video games heading. She has a ton of stuff to browse regarding video games, kids nad learning, so i suggest checking her site out as well.

http://www.motherjones.com/commentary/columns/2000/06/violent_media.html

Mary

Currently my 9 year old and his dad are into halo, and I'm getting that same quessy feeling when my 6 year old daughter pulls up a chair and starts walking around with a semi automatic attached to her hand. I think I'll go read this article again to remind myself, she is exploring safely with a parent available to discuss what she is experiencing.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
